name: 254cec22-6c9f-4362-a096-1a3b162313df
displayName: Select another payer when posting - import only

text.text: How can I skip a secondary payer and proceed directly to the patient or tertiary payer when importing an 835 into the system?

text: To skip a secondary payer and proceed directly to the patient or tertiary payer when importing an 835 into the system, you can click Payments on the navigation bar and then click on the deposit date of the 835. This feature lets you decide who the next payer is in the coordination of benefits.

text.text: What steps do I need to follow to access the payment details for a specific deposit date in the system?

text: To access the payment details for a specific deposit date, you can use the Credit Posting report. To run the report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Credit Posting. 3. Show Deactivated Users: Select True to show deactivated users in the report. 4. Posted by: Select All or select one or more users. 5. Start and End Date: Pick how far back you want the report to start and the date you want it to end. 6. Date Filter Type: Deposit Date or Post Date. 7. Display HCPCS: Select True to show HCPCS in the report. 8. Click View Report.

text.text: What information is displayed in the "Current payer after posting" field while reviewing payment details?

text: The "Current payer after posting" field displays the next payer listed in the EOB. If you want to change to another payer, you can click the field and select a payer from the list.

text.text: When viewing the payment details, where can I find the option to select another payer for posting?

text: The option to select another payer for posting is located at the bottom of the view that shows the details of what you are posting.

text.text: How do I change the payer for the next posting after reviewing the payment details?

text: To change the payer for the next posting, you can click the "Current payer after posting" field and select a payer from the list.

text.text: What happens if I want to switch to a different payer listed in the EOB during payment posting?

text: You can change the payer for the next posting by clicking the "Current payer after posting" field and selecting a payer from the list.

text.text: Can I manually select a payer from the list displayed in the "Current payer after posting" field?

text: Yes, you can manually select a payer from the list displayed in the "Current payer after posting" field.

text.text: Is there a limit to the number of times I can switch between payers during payment posting?

text: There is no limit to the number of times you can switch between payers during payment posting.

text.text: How does selecting another payer affect the subsequent processing of payment details in the system?

text: The system will remember the matching from this point forward.

text.text: Are there any specific criteria or considerations to keep in mind when choosing another payer during payment posting?

text: When selecting another payer, you can skip a secondary payer and move right to the patient or to the tertiary. You can also choose to skip facility, collections, or state debt payers.

text.text: Can I undo or revert the selection of another payer after it has been saved?

text: Yes, you can undo or revert the selection of another payer after it has been saved.

text.text: Explain selecting next payer when posting

text: When you are importing an 835 into the system, there could be times when you want to skip a secondary payer and move right to the patient or to the tertiary. This feature lets you decide who the next payer is in the coordination of benefits.

text.text: How to select next payer when posting?

text: To select next payer when posting, you can click on the deposit date of the 835. This feature lets you decide who the next payer is in the coordination of benefits.
